summary:
Do you find that magic staves in Skyrim are tedious and underwhelming?
Add 12 Battle Staves with combat style a la Dragon Age.

[size=3]Try these mods out!
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67587/?]Throwing Battleaxe[/url] for badass.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16127/?]Arcane Fist - Unarmed Spell Combat[/url] for arcane monk.[/size]


[center][youtube]hheclGlE8Zg[/youtube][/center]


[color=red][size=6][font=impact]MUST READ[/font][/size][/color]
You must place this mod at the bottom of your load order to get it to work.
Incompatible with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67587/?] Titanical Throw - Battleaxes Throwing [/url]

For user who dl prior 2.1. [size=4]IF[/size], you haven't download 1.0/2.0 ignore this. 

[spoiler]
Place Removespell.txt under your game directory
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\skyrim

In Removespell.txt,
Change every "xx" to your mod load order formid index

Open NMM
Next to your mod, the column Load order is your Formid index

Ex.
=Aetherial=
Player.removespell xx014c71
Player.removeitem xx014c62 1

My formid load order index is D8

=Aetherial=
Player.removespell d8014c71
Player.removeitem d8014c62 1

Once done with everything, ingame, type in console command: Bat Removespell

There will be a chest that spawn right under you feets. Grab your staves back from there.
[/spoiler]


[b][size=5]Changelog[/size][/b]

V2.2
-Fix opponents being healed on melee combat
-Add Sound Effects on melee swing
-Change Magnus projectile from Beam to Missile

V2.1
-Add script to remove spells from player spell menu
Note: Spells will still be add to your menu but will now be remove once you un-equip or change staff.

V2.0:
-Add Staff of Aetherial
-Hotfix Staff of Sanguine where conjure dremora would become instantly hostile towards players.
-Balance Staff of Thunderbolt
-Better Description

V1.0:
-Initial Release

[b][size=5]Technical[/size][/b]
Add 12 Battle Staves in-game that is craftable at the forge.
Utilize Battleaxe animation to cast spell.... a la Dragon Age.
You can also use the staves to whack your opponent's face in melee combat dealing both physical and magic damages.
Spell damage is based on DestructionPowerMod and melee on TwohandedPowerMod, which means if you have  te right,perks or magic effects that have either both of them, your damage output will increase.
Battle Staves levels from both Destruction and Two-handed tree. 

Battle Staff of Fireball
Battle Staff of incineration
Battle Staff of Ice Spike
Battle Staff of Ice Storm
Battle Staff of Chain Lightning
Battle Staff of Thunderbolt
===
Battle Staff of Aetherial
Battle Staff of Magnus
battle Staff of Miraak
Battle Staff of Sanguine
Battle Staff of Skull of Corruption
Battle Staff of Wabbajack

[b][size=5]How to get[/size][/b]
Craft at the forge with required material perks.
To get a Battle Staff you will need vanilla materials and a spell tome of the same spell.

Ex:
Battle Staff of Fireball
1x Firewood
1x Spell Tome: Fireball
2x Leather strips
4x Steel Ingots

Daedric Staves requires their original staves.

Ex:
Battle Skull of Corruption
1x Skull of Corruption

===

You will be able to get every original back by recrafting them.

Ex:
Skull of Corruption
1x Battle Skull of Corruption

[b][size=5]Requirement[/size][/b]
Skyrim latest version
Dawnguard and Dragonborn

[b][size=5]Bugs[/size][/b]
Careful about script lagging. If your game is script heavy, couple with a low fps, the script might take 2-3 or more seconds before it fire.
